goal.name: durability
goal.title: Durability
goal.description: Evidence of structural integrity; ability to withstand rigors of competition

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Quite fragile; breaks a lot Base weak, falls apart when handled or run Difficult to assemble

range.title: Developing
range.description: frequent or significant faults/repairs Robot has some stability Assembles with few errors

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: rare faults/repairs Robot stable, but not robust Assembles with no errors

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: sound construction, no repairs Robot stable and robust Robot assembles easily

goal.name: mechanical_efficiency
goal.title: Mechanical Efficiency
goal.description: Economic use of parts and time; easy to repair and modify Components work together

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Excessive parts or time to repair/modify Robot lacks critical design components: works, stays together, efficient part use Few components work together, belong together

range.title: Developing
range.description: Inefficient parts or time to repair/modify Robot lacks some critical design components: works, stays together, efficient parts use Some components work or belong together

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Appropriate use of parts and time to repair/modify Robot lacks few critical design components: works, stays together, efficient parts use Most components work and belong together

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Streamlined use of parts and time to repair/modify Robot is elegant, complete. All components work together and look like they belong together.

goal.name: mechanization
goal.title: Mechanization
goal.description: Ability of robot mechanisms to move or act with appropriate speed, strength and accuracy for intended tasks (propulsion and execution)

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Imbalance of speed, strength and accuracy on most tasks Difficulty going same distance repeatedly, turns inaccurate or inconsistent Too fast for accuracy, too slow to complete mission

range.title: Developing
range.description: Imbalance of speed, strength and accuracy on some tasks. Goes defined distances and turns sometimes. Somewhat too fast for accuracy, or too slow to complete mission

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Appropriate balance of speed, strength and accuracy on most tasks. Goes defined distance and turns reasonable accurately and consistently. Good speed balance.

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Appropriate balance of speed, strength and accuracy on every task. Goes defined distance and turns accurately, efficiently and consistently. Adjusts speed for optimum control.

goal.name: attachments
goal.title: Attachments and Sensors
goal.description: Attachments and Sensors, if used, are an integrated part of the design, they are used appropriately and achieve consistent results.

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Sensors used incorrectly, Weak or poorly designed attachments, difficult to add/remove.

range.title: Developing
range.description: Sensor use inconsistent. Not modular or consistent attachments, attachments awkward to add/remove. Not repeatable.

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Sensors used appropriately. Attachments somewhat modular and work as expected. Easy to add/remove. Somewhat repeatable.

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Sensor use precise and repeatable. Attachments modular and work as expected, repeatedly. They look like they belong to the robot.

goal.name: kids_work
goal.title: Kids Did the Work
goal.description: Appropriate balance between team responsibility and coach guidance

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Excessive coach guidance AND limited team responsibility. Little knowledge of why parts are as they are on robot. Little or no understanding of what pieces do what.

range.title: Developing
range.description: Excessive coach guidance OR limited team responsibility. Minimal understanding of underlying design, technology, strategy and robot structure.

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Good balance between team responsibility and coach guidance. Moderate understanding of robot structure, underlying design, strategy and technology.

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Team independence with minimal coach guidance. Thorough understanding of robot structure, underlying design, strategy and technology.

goal.name: design_process
goal.title: Design Process
goal.description: Ability to develop and explain improvement cycles where alternatives are considered and narrowed, selections tested, design improved.

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Disorganized AND poorly explained improvement cycles. Uses standard design. No design process (concept build test refine)

range.title: Developing
range.description: Disorganized OR poorly explained improvement cycles. Some forethought in initial design. Refinement of robot not well communicated.

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Systematic and well-explained improvement cycle. Basic understanding of design process, evidence of concept planning, building, testing, refining

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Systematic, well-explained and well-documented improvement cycle. Good communication of complete design process.

goal.name: mission_strategy
goal.title: Mission Strategy
goal.description: Ability to clearly define and describe the team’s game strategy.

range.title: Beginning
range.description: No clear goals AND no clear strategy. Strategy based only on ease of task – no combined missions or maximizing time/effort.

range.title: Developing
range.description: No clear goals OR no clear strategy. Strategy based on ease of tasks, few risks. Some consideration or time/efforts/points.

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Clear strategy to accomplish the team’s well defined goals. Effective strategic planning, combining of missions, routes, attachments.

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Clear strategy to accomplish most/all game missions and team goals. Excellent/innovative strategy, combining missions, routes, points.

goal.name: innovation
goal.title: Innovation
goal.description: Creation of new, unique or unexpected features (in design, programming, strategy or applications) that are beneficial in performing the tasks.

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Original features with no added value or potential. Design, drive, structure are standard. Expected sensor use only.

range.title: Developing
range.description: Original features with some added value or potential. Either design creative, unique use of drive train or structure, or unique mission strategy.

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Original features with the potential to add significant value. More than one unique design, drive train, structure, or mission strategy.

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Original features that add significant value. Extremely unique/creative design, drive train, structure and/or mission strategy.

goal.name: problem_identification
goal.title: Problem Identification
goal.description: Clear definition of the problem being studied

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Unclear, few details Doesn’t relate to FLL theme, no understanding of technical terms

range.title: Developing
range.description: Somewhat clear, details missing Relates only poorly to the FLL theme, limited understanding of technical terms

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: clear, detailed Relates fairly well to the FLL theme, understand of technical terms, but didn’t explain them all clearly

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Very clear, very detailed Integrates well with the FLLS theme, demonstrated and shared a full understand of technical term

goal.name: sources_information
goal.title: Sources of Information
goal.description: Types (e.g. books, magazines, websites, reports and other resources) and number of quality source cited, including professions in the field

range.title: Beginning
range.description: one type of information cited, minimal sources No hard data presented as background

range.title: Developing
range.description: two types of information cited, several sources Weak or limited data to support proposal

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: three types of information cited, many sources, including professionals Adequate data supporting problem identification

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: four(+) types of information cited, extensive sources, including professionals Substantial data supporting proposed problem

goal.name: problem_analysis
goal.title: Problem Analysis
goal.description: Depth to which the problem was studied and analyzed by the team

range.title: Beginning
range.description: minimal study, no team analysis No research on the impact of the problem, alternative theories or interpretations ignored

range.title: Developing
range.description: minimal study, some team analysis Limited research on the impact of the problem, alternative theories obscured

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: sufficient study and analysis by team Impact of problem clearly researched, considered alternative theories and had clear arguments

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: extensive study and analysis by team Impact of problem thoroughly examined and applied to solution. Persuasive argument against alternatives

goal.name: review
goal.title: Review Existing Solutions
goal.description: Extent to which existing theories and solutions were analyzed by the team, including an effort to verify the originality of the team’s solution

range.title: Beginning
range.description: minimal review, no team analysis No research on existing solutions or technologies used to address the problem

range.title: Developing
range.description: minimal review, some team analysis Limited research on existing solutions/tech. used to address the problem

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: sufficient review and analysis by team Present solutions/techs. researched by not fully considered.

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: extensive review and analysis by team Clearly researched existing solutions/techs, applied knowledge and presented the information clearly

goal.name: team_solution
goal.title: Team Solution
goal.description: Clear explanation of the proposed solution

range.title: Beginning
range.description: difficult to understand No solution presented Team lacks enthusiasm for solution

range.title: Developing
range.description: some parts confusing and unclear Team members showed some enthusiasm

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: understandable but may not address the problem Team members were actively participating and showed excitement, Project is a group effort.

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: easy to understand by all and clearly addressed the problem Team members were articulate and enthusiastic about their solution

goal.name: innovation
goal.title: Innovation
goal.description: Degree to which the team’s solution makes life better by improving existing options, developing a new application of existing ideas, or solving the problem in a completely new way

range.title: Beginning
range.description: existing solution/application Solution is not innovative or new.

range.title: Developing
range.description: solution/application contains some original element(s) Solution is somewhat innovative or uses limited knowledge of science and or technology.

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: original solution/application Solution is innovative and applies some knowledge of science and/or technology

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Original solution/application with the potential to add significant value Solution is innovative and applies knowledge of science and/or technology

goal.name: implementation
goal.title: Implementation
goal.description: Consideration of factors for implementation (cost, easy of manufacturing, etc.)

range.title: Beginning
range.description: minimal factors considered

range.title: Developing
range.description: some factors considered

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: factors well considered, some questions about proposed solution

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: factors well considered and feasible solution proposed.

goal.name: sharing
goal.title: Sharing
goal.description: Degree to which the team shared their Project before the tournament with others who might benefit from the team’s efforts

range.title: Beginning
range.description: shared with one individual did not consider how their problem might impact themselves and others

range.title: Developing
range.description: shared with one group Considered how this might impact themselves or family, but not others

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: shared with one individual or group who may benefit Considered how this might impact themselves and family and took that into account

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: shared with multiple individuals or groups who may benefit Considered how this impacts others and implemented a plan to include those impacts

goal.name: creativity
goal.title: Creativity
goal.description: Imagination used to develop and delivery the presentation

range.title: Beginning
range.description: minimally engaging OR unimaginative Lacked excitement

range.title: Developing
range.description: engaging OR imaginative Information presented with limited creativity

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: engaging AND imaginative Creative elements used in the presentation

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: very engaging AND exceptionally imaginative Unique elements of creativity included

goal.name: presentation_effectiveness
goal.title: Presentation Effectiveness
goal.description: Message delivery and organization of the presentation

range.title: Beginning
range.description: unclear OR disorganized No supporting material, unable to answer judge questions

range.title: Developing
range.description: somewhat clear, minimal organization Ineffective visual aids and support material, hesitant answers to judge questions

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: mostly clear, mostly organized Supporting aids/material complement presentation, adequate answers

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: very clear AND well organized, Carefully chosen aids/material add to presentation, comprehensive answers

goal.name: discovery
goal.title: Discovery
goal.description: Balanced emphasis on all three aspects (Robot, Project, Core Values) of FLL; it’s not just about winning awards

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Emphasis on only one aspect; others neglected Problems identified, but steps not taken to solve Team doesn’t mention new skills acquired

range.title: Developing
range.description: Emphasis on two aspects; one neglected Problems identified, but solution was inadequate Limited attention to new skills

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Emphasis on all three aspects Problems identified and solutions found Team implied new skills acquired

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Balanced emphasis on all three aspects Problems identified, solutions found working together. Team demonstrated new skills

goal.name: team_spirit
goal.title: Team Spirit
goal.description: Enthusiastic and fun expression of the team identity

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Minimal enthusiasm AND minimal identity Limited eye contact, member disengaged

range.title: Developing
range.description: Minimal enthusiasm OR minimal identity 1/2 the team interested, other members not paying attention

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Team is enthusiastic and fun; clear identity Most of team appears excited, members enthusiastic, but talk over each other

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Team engages others in their enthusiasm and fun; clear identity Concrete examples of enthusiasm, all equally invested and speak

goal.name: integration
goal.title: Integration
goal.description: Application of FLL values and skills outside FLL (ability to describe current and potential examples from daily life

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Team does not apply FLL values and skills outside FLL. Members compete with each other to talk. Members show no awareness of school/ community issues No mention of future goals

range.title: Developing
range.description: Team able to describe at least one example Team shows limited awareness of school/ community issues Members imply future aspirations

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Team able to describe multiple examples Increased awareness of outside issue evident Team is vague about how this translates to other aspects of life. Suggest how it may have helped.

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Team able to describe multiple examples, including individual stories Demonstrated increased awareness and clearly discuss how this translates to other areas of life.

goal.name: effectiveness
goal.title: Effectiveness
goal.description: Problem solving and decision making processes help team achieve their goals

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Team goals AND team processes unclear Team members no collaborating

range.title: Developing
range.description: Team goals OR team processes unclear Team members helping each other if asked Various solutions tested in series, not thought out

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Clear team goals and processes Members help each other without asking to advance progress Team tested or thought about various solutions

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Clear processes enable team to accomplish well defined goals Members can fill in for each other easily Various solutions tested and best incorporated

goal.name: efficiency
goal.title: Efficiency
goal.description: Resources used relative to what the team accomplishes (time management, distribution of roles, responsibilities)

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Limited time management AND unclear roles Not clear who completed which tasks

range.title: Developing
range.description: Limited time management OR unclear roles

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Excellent time management and role definition allows team to accomplish most goals Clearly defined roles

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Excellent time management and role definition allows team to accomplish all goals Clearly defined roles, understood by all.

goal.name: kids_work
goal.title: Kids Do the Work
goal.description: Appropriate balance between team responsibility and coach guidance

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Limited team responsibility AND excessive coach guidance Decision making unclear, no team cooperation

range.title: Developing
range.description: Limited team responsibility OR excessive coach guidance Team able to describe some decision making

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Good balance between team responsibility and coach guidance Team cooperation, decisions made by team

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Team independence with minimal coach guidance Cooperation within team is dominant theme. Team owns solutions

goal.name: inclusion
goal.title: Inclusion
goal.description: Consideration and appreciation for the contributions (ideas and skills) of all team members, with balanced involvement

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Unbalanced team involvement AND lack of appreciation for contributions Only one team member spoke, worked at judging

range.title: Developing
range.description: Unbalanced team involvement OR lack of appreciation for contributions Multiple members spoke, but one in full charge

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Balanced team involvement AND appreciation for contributions of most team members Members helped others

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Balanced team involvement AND appreciation for contributions of all team members All involved fully

goal.name: respect
goal.title: Respect
goal.description: Team members act and speak with integrity so others feel valued—especially when solving problems or resolving conflicts

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Not evident with majority of team members

range.title: Developing
range.description: Evident with majority of team members Only when absolutely necessary

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Almost always evident with all team members

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Always evident, even in the most difficult situations

goal.name: coopertition
goal.title: Coopertition
goal.description: Team competes in the spirit of friendly competition and cooperates with others

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Not evident with majority of team members Members don’t help each other. Confrontation is evident

range.title: Developing
range.description: Evident with majority of team members Members rarely helped each other, coexistence is dominant theme

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Almost always evident with all team members Members implied they helped other and worked together. Some collaboration is evident.

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Always evident, even in difficult situations—and team actively helps other teams Shows respect and mutual help during judging,

goal.name: code_structure
goal.title: Code Structure and Reuse
goal.description: Programs show proper use of variables, loops, subroutines and there is an understanding of code reuse.

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Variables, loops, subroutines and conditions defined, but not used.

range.title: Developing
range.description: Variables, loops, subroutines and conditions exist, but not fully understood or utilized.

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Variables, loops, subroutines and conditions are used and understood. Some signs of code reuse.

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Variables, loops, subroutines and conditions are used effectively. Code reuse evident and understood.

goal.name: kids_work
goal.title: Kids Did the Work
goal.description: Appropriate balance between team responsibility and coach guidance

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Excessive coach guidance AND limited team responsibility. Little knowledge of how programs work on robot. Little or no understanding of what pieces do what.

range.title: Developing
range.description: Excessive coach guidance OR limited team responsibility. Appears primarily directed by the coach. Minimal understanding of underlying design, strategy and robot programming.

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Good balance between team responsibility and coach guidance. Moderate understanding of underlying design, strategy and robot programming. Kids describe most missions.

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Team independence with minimal coach guidance. Thorough understanding of underlying design, strategy and programming. Kids describe missions and reference appropriate programs

goal.name: quality
goal.title: Programming Quality
goal.description: Programs are appropriate for the intended purpose and achieve consistent results, assuming no mechanical faults

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Would not achieve purpose AND would be inconsistent. Programs inefficient and/or unpredictable.

range.title: Developing
range.description: Would not achieve purpose OR would be inconsistent. Programs results still somewhat unpredictable.

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Should achieve purpose repeatedly. Efficient and as expected. Easy to modify/debug. Well commented.

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Should achieve purpose every time. Programs logically organized, efficient and always work, even for complex tasks

goal.name: efficiency
goal.title: Programming Efficiency
goal.description: Programs are modular, streamlined and understandable

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Excessive code and difficult to understand. Programs disorganized. Only uses simple coding constructs, no knowledge of complex language constructs.

range.title: Developing
range.description: Inefficient code and challenging to understand. Programs somewhat organized, efficient at a couple tasks. Some understanding of language constructs.

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Appropriate code and easy to understand. Organized, the team as a good understanding of language constructs.

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Streamline code and easy for anyone to understand. Logically organized, and the team has an excellent understanding and use of language constructs.

goal.name: automation
goal.title: Automation/Navigation
goal.description: Ability of the robot to move or act as intended using mechanical and/or sensor feedback (with minimal reliance on team intervention and/or program timing.

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Frequent team intervention to aim AND retrieve robot. Sensors inappropriately used, and didn’t provide any help.

range.title: Developing
range.description: Frequent team intervention to aim OR retrieve robot. Sensors occasionally used effectively. Provide some aid in navigation and manipulation.

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Robot moves/acts as intended repeatedly with occasional team intervention. Sensors were effectively used, repeatable, provided definitely improvement.

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Robot moves/acts as intended every time with no team intervention. Sensors guarantee certain actions every time.

goal.name: design_process
goal.title: Design Process
goal.description: Ability to develop and explain improvement cycles where alternatives are considered and narrowed, selections tested, design improved.

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Disorganized AND poorly explained improvement cycles. Uses simple programming design. No design process (concept code test refine)

range.title: Developing
range.description: Disorganized OR poorly explained improvement cycles. Some forethought in initial programming design. Refinement of code not well communicated.

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Systematic and well-explained improvement cycle. Basic understanding of design process, evidence of concept planning, coding, testing, refining

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Systematic, well-explained and well-documented improvement cycle. Good communication of complete design process.

goal.name: mission_strategy
goal.title: Mission Strategy
goal.description: Ability to clearly define and describe the team’s game strategy.

range.title: Beginning
range.description: No clear goals AND no clear strategy. Strategy based only on ease of task – no combined missions or maximizing time/effort.

range.title: Developing
range.description: No clear goals OR no clear strategy. Strategy based on ease of tasks, few risks. Some consideration or time/efforts/points.

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Clear strategy to accomplish the team’s well defined goals. Effective strategic planning, combining of missions, routes, attachments, code.

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Clear strategy to accomplish most/all game missions and team goals. Excellent/innovative strategy, combining missions, routes, points.

goal.name: innovation
goal.title: Innovation
goal.description: Creation of new, unique or unexpected features (in design, programming, strategy or applications) that are beneficial in performing the tasks.

range.title: Beginning
range.description: Original features with no added value or potential. Programs and strategy are standard. Expected sensor use only.

range.title: Developing
range.description: Original features with some added value or potential. A unique use of programming or mission strategy.

range.title: Accomplished
range.description: Original features with the potential to add significant value. More than one unique use of program controls or mission coordinating strategy.

range.title: Exemplary
range.description: Original features that add significant value. Extremely unique/creative/ unexpected program, control, construct or mission strategy.
